intro: Microsaccus, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Microsaccus species often have hairy stems and leaves adapted to conserve water. They are typically shrubs or subshrubs with compact growth forms.
